Entries.default: "Please, help me... I do not know how it is you came by this place, but please, you must save us."
At a glance, you take this man to be one of the Huana. His face crumples as you approach, and he sags in his bindings, murmuring repeated oaths of gratitude.

"They took someone else. Badema. She must still be in the cages, to the southeast. These... creatures must have a key somewhere. 

Please, help her. I... I think I will be sick."

"May Ngati guide you to calm waters."

He staggers for the entrance.
"Rikuhu takes his life, and spares mine. Please, let me free. I cannot stay here any longer."
[Untie him.]
"How did you end up in here?"
"Stay put for the time being."
"Please, cut me loose! Don't leave me here!"

"I did not believe my eyes... Ekera, Ngati has answered my prayers."

At a glance, you take this man to be one of the Huana. His face crumples as you approach, and he sags in his bindings, murmuring repeated oaths of gratitude.
"What? Wait! You cannot mean to leave me here!"
"W-we are just merchants. Traders. The lizards surrounded our wagon, and dragged us here... Tumau is gone, but Badema... Surely she is still here."
"You are one of those from Rauatai? Perhaps they speak true, then, when they say they can protect us."
"Does it matter? Cut him loose and ask questions later."

"Those animals... ate him. My friend. I could only watch..."

He hangs his head, shuddering.

"Ekera, you have my thanks once again."

The man rubs at his chafed wrists.
"It will be a hard journey back to the city."
"Where are we?"
"What? O-oh... It is an old shrine to Ngati. The priests, they went to Neketaka, and now there are no guards on these roads."
"I...Two days, with a cart, I think? I am not sure. ...But how is it you do not know?"
"How far are we from the city?"
"And this is what animancers consider science? I am not impressed." He folds his arms.
"Di verus? Incredible. We did it. We actually did it!"
"Please, cut me loose! Don't leave me here!"
